meanings.sent1: During the presentation, he made a slipup by forgetting his lines.
meanings.sent2: She realized her slipup when she sent the email to the wrong person.
meanings.sent3: The slipup in the recipe turned the cake into a salty disaster.
meanings.sent4: His slipup on the dance floor made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The slipup in the code caused the program to crash.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I slipup sometimes when trying to tie my shoelaces quickly.
meanings.sent2: Don't slipup by forgetting to double-check your work before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: She tends to slipup when she's nervous, like dropping her phone.
meanings.sent4: If you slipup during the performance, just keep going and smile.
meanings.sent5: He didn't want to slipup during the interview, so he prepared thoroughly.

meanings.definition: An act of slipping or sliding.
meanings.sent1: The icy sidewalk caused a slipup for the pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: The slipup on the wet floor led to a minor accident.
meanings.sent3: The slipup on the banana peel was unexpected but hilarious.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful recovery from the slipup impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The slipup on the ice rink resulted in a comical fall.
